results.name: Square array A(n,k) of numbers of length n ternary words with at least k 0-digits between any other digits (n,k >= 0), read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
formula: A(n,k) = 3^n if k=0, else A(n,k) = 2*n+1 if n<=k+1, else A(n,k) = A(n-1,k) + 2*A(n-k-1,k).
example: A(3,1) = 11, because 11 ternary words of length 3 have at least 1 0-digit between any other digits: 000, 001, 002, 010, 020, 100, 101, 102, 200, 201, 202.
maple: A := proc (n::nonnegint, k::nonnegint) option remember; if k=0 then 3^n elif n<=k+1 then 2*n+1 else A(n-1, k) +2*A(n-k-1, k) fi end: seq(seq(A(n,d-n), n=0..d), d=0..14);
mathematica: a[n_, 0] := 3^n; a[n_, k_] /; n <= k+1 := 2*n+1; a[n_, k_] := a[n, k] = a[n-1, k] + 2*a[n-k-1, k]; Table[a[n-k, k], {n, 0, 14}, {k, n, 0, -1}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 11 2013 *)
